title: State board of naturopathic medicine
context: §455-4 State board of naturopathic medicine. The governor shall appoint the board of naturopathic medicine, consisting of five members. Each member shall serve until the member&rsquo;s successor is appointed and qualified. Three members of the board, before appointment, shall have been licensed as a naturopathic physician in the State and two shall be public members. The members of the board may elect a chairperson and a vice-chairperson who shall each serve one year or until a successor is elected. [L 1937, c 221, §3; RL 1945, §2654; RL 1955, §66-4; am L Sp 1959 2d, c 1, §5; HRS §455-4; am L 1978, c 208, §6; gen ch 1985; am L 1986, c 76, §8; am L 1992, c 9, §1 and c 202, §103; am L Sp 2009, c 22, §6] Cross References Departmental administration, see §§26-9 and 26-35. Attorney General Opinions This statute is constitutional, with regard to the use of the phrase &ldquo;appointed and qualified&rdquo; to describe when a successor&rsquo;s appointment terminates a holdover member&rsquo;s position. Att. Gen. Op. 16-3.
